result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac R. Luther

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 4:18 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF699, 15CF757, 15CF960, AND 16CF20. 
State appears by Intern Davis Runde with DDA Theresa Wetzseteon; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty John Bachman.  
State requests jury trial be set in 15CF699. 

PLEA HEARING IN 15CF757, 15CF960, AND 16CF20.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CF757: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF960: Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CF960: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 16CF20: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                  : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                  : Ct. 3 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 4 years probation - CONDITIONS on all: maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed; no possesion of controlled substances except prescriptions as prescribed; AODA and follow through; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITION On Ct. 1 in 15CF960 ONLY: 30 days MCJ with huber for work/treatment if eligible;

COURT finds the def entitled to 205 days jail credit in 16CF20 and 2 days jail credit in 15CF960 if revoked. 

Atty Bachman requests speedy trial in 15CF699. 
CC set for 8/10/2016 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA to set jury trial. 
Adj: 4:38 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 4, 2016 at 04:05 pm.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:07 pm 
INCLUDES 16CF20, 15CF960, 15CF757, AND 15CF699. 
State appears by Intern Davis Runde with DDA Theresa Wetzsteon; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty John Bachman. 
Date and Time set for FPT in 16CF20. 
State notes parties have not reached an agreement. Discovery is complete. No anticipated motions to be heard prior to trial. 
Court advises parties to file any MIL and proposed jury instructions 3 business days prior to trial. 
Parties discuss bail jumping charges. 
Court directs parties to be present at 8:30 the morning of trial. 
Bond Continues. 
Adj: 1:16 pm
Review hearing on July 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing on July 6, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on May 11, 2016 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on May 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Case Called: 1:23 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF699, 15CF757, 15CF960, AND 16CF20. 
State appears by DDA Theresa Wetzsteon; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Pauline Toulouse. 

WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARING IN 16CF20. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information to be filed by close of business today and will be identical to criminal complaint. 

ARRAIGNMENTS IN 15CF699, 15CF757, 15CF960, AND 16CF20. 
Readings waived. 
Plea: Not Guilty on all. 

COURT removes prelim set for 1/20/2016 in Br. 4. 
Bond Continues. 

Adj: 1:26 pm

Clerk Marisa.
